intro: Calandrinia ptychosperma, commonly known as the narrow-fruit portulaca, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a low-growing annual herb that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features fleshy, succulent leaves and produces small, vibrant flowers in shades of red, pink, and yellow. Its fruit is a dry, capsule that splits open to release seeds. Calandrinia ptychosperma is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its drought tolerance and colorful blooms.
